meanings.definition: A group of ships or boats.
meanings.sent1: The flota of fishing boats sailed out to sea.
meanings.sent2: The naval flota patrolled the coastline.
meanings.sent3: The flota of rubber ducks in the bathtub made bath time fun.
meanings.sent4: The flota of clouds drifted lazily across the sky.
meanings.sent5: The flota of colorful sailboats racing in the regatta was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: A group of vehicles or aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The flota of cars waited at the traffic light.
meanings.sent2: The airline's flota of planes flew passengers to various destinations.
meanings.sent3: The flota of bicycles parked outside the school created a colorful scene.
meanings.sent4: The flota of hot air balloons dotted the sky during the festival.
meanings.sent5: The flota of delivery trucks lined up to unload their cargo at the warehouse.

meanings.definition: A group of people or things moving together.
meanings.sent1: The flota of students walked in a line during the school field trip.
meanings.sent2: The flota of ants marched in a straight line towards their nest.
meanings.sent3: The flota of colorful balloons floated together in the parade.
meanings.sent4: The flota of leaves swirled in the wind on a crisp autumn day.
meanings.sent5: The flota of birds flew in perfect formation across the sky.
